pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with the President of the European Council, Charles Michel | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the President of the European Council, Charles Michel, to discuss COVID-19.

Prime Minister Trudeau and President Michel discussed the health, social, and economic impacts of COVID-19, and the significant measures being taken in Canada and the European Union to mitigate the impacts through support for individuals and businesses.

The two leaders agreed that international coordination is an essential element of a strong and effective response to COVID-19, and discussed how the G7 can contribute to building the resilience of the global economy. Prime Minister Trudeau and President Michel looked forward to discussing this further in an upcoming call with G7 leaders.

COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving global challenge. The Government of Canada is working closely with local, provincial, territorial, and international partners to minimize its health, economic, and social impacts in Canada and around the world.
